references.paper_title: Stable video diffusion: Scaling latent video diffusion models to large datasets
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it directly addresses the challenge of scaling latent video diffusion models, a core issue in efficient video generation. The research on scaling these models is critical for achieving high-quality results while maintaining efficiency, directly relating to the core goal of the FasterCache method.

This paper introduces classifier-free guidance (CFG), a technique that significantly improves the quality of generated images and videos in diffusion models.  The FasterCache method leverages the understanding of CFG's computational cost and its inherent redundancy to design its CFG-Cache component, therefore this is highly relevant to understanding the context and advancements that influence the proposed method.

This foundational paper establishes the theoretical underpinnings of diffusion probabilistic models (DPMs), which are the basis of the video diffusion models considered in this work.  Understanding DPMs is fundamental to grasping the core concepts and challenges addressed by FasterCache, such as efficient sampling and reducing computational cost while preserving image quality.

As a direct extension of denoising diffusion probabilistic models to videos, this paper is crucial to the present work's context. Understanding video diffusion models' unique challenges, particularly in terms of computational cost and efficient inference, is essential for evaluating the contribution and impact of the proposed FasterCache.

This paper explores scalable diffusion models using transformers, which are a key architecture for video generation.  The FasterCache paper focuses on video diffusion models using transformers, so understanding the scalability aspects of this architecture is necessary to evaluate the contribution and impact of the proposed FasterCache method.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper focuses on high-resolution image synthesis using latent diffusion models. Understanding the techniques used in high-resolution image generation is important to the context of the current paper, as it touches upon challenges related to computational complexity and quality preservation that are highly relevant to the FasterCache method's design.

references.paper_title: Progressive distillation for fast sampling of diffusion models
references.reason: This paper proposes progressive distillation for efficient sampling in diffusion models.  The FasterCache method seeks to improve efficiency without sacrificing quality, therefore understanding how other techniques address efficiency while controlling quality is helpful in establishing the context and uniqueness of this contribution.

This paper focuses on adversarial diffusion distillation, a technique aimed at improving efficiency in diffusion models.  The FasterCache method is also focused on improving efficiency, hence understanding different strategies employed in achieving this goal is necessary for putting the FasterCache method in context.

references.paper_title: VBench: Comprehensive benchmark suite for video generative models
references.reason: This paper introduces VBench, a comprehensive benchmark suite specifically designed for evaluating video generative models.  Because the FasterCache paper uses VBench for evaluating its method, understanding the specifics of this benchmark suite is necessary to comprehend the evaluation process and results presented in the FasterCache paper.

references.paper_title: The unreasonable effectiveness of deep features as a perceptual metric
references.reason: This paper introduces LPIPS, a perceptual metric used for evaluating image quality.  As the FasterCache paper also uses LPIPS as a metric for evaluating the quality of generated videos, understanding LPIPS is necessary to interpret the results presented in the FasterCache paper, thus providing critical context for evaluating the contributions of this paper.

references.paper_title: Flashattention: Fast and memory-efficient exact attention with io-awareness
references.reason: This paper introduces FlashAttention, an optimized attention mechanism used to improve the efficiency of transformer networks. Because FasterCache is evaluated using models with transformers, understanding how the efficiency of transformers is improved is essential for evaluating the context and impact of the FasterCache method.

references.paper_title: Pixart-σ: Weak-to-strong training of diffusion transformer for 4k text-to-image generation
references.reason: This paper focuses on high-resolution image generation, which is relevant to the topic of video generation.  The FasterCache method also aims to improve the efficiency of video generation, so understanding how high-resolution image generation is achieved is helpful for contextualizing this paper's contributions and impact.

references.paper_title: Pixart-8: Fast and controllable image generation with latent consistency models
references.reason: This paper presents a method for fast and controllable image generation.  The FasterCache method also focuses on improving the speed of generation, so understanding this fast generation method is relevant to contextualizing the FasterCache paper's contribution.

references.paper_title: d-dit: A training-free acceleration method tailored for diffusion transformers
references.reason: This paper proposes a training-free method to accelerate diffusion transformers, similar to FasterCache.  Comparing and contrasting the two methods helps to establish the novelty and uniqueness of the FasterCache approach.

references.paper_title: Ptqd: Accurate post-training quantization for diffusion models
references.reason: This paper discusses post-training quantization for diffusion models, which is a technique used to improve efficiency.  FasterCache also aims to improve efficiency, so this is relevant for contextualizing the proposed method relative to other existing efficiency improvements in diffusion models.

references.paper_title: Latte: Latent diffusion transformer for video generation
references.reason: This paper introduces Latte, a video diffusion model used in the experimental evaluation of FasterCache.  Understanding the specifics of Latte is essential for interpreting the results and evaluating the effectiveness of FasterCache in the context of a real-world video generation model.

references.paper_title: Deepcache: Accelerating diffusion models for free
references.reason: This paper introduces DeepCache, another training-free method for accelerating diffusion models.  Understanding the approach used in DeepCache is relevant to contextualizing the FasterCache method, which also aims to accelerate diffusion models without requiring any additional training.

references.paper_title: Scaling rectified flow transformers for high-resolution image synthesis
references.reason: This paper focuses on scaling rectified flow transformers for high-resolution image synthesis, which is a related area to video generation.  The FasterCache method aims to improve the efficiency of video generation, so understanding how efficiency is improved in high-resolution image generation is useful for contextualizing this paper's contributions and impact.

references.paper_title: Cogvideox: Text-to-video diffusion models with an expert transformer
references.reason: This paper introduces CogVideoX, a text-to-video diffusion model that is used in the experimental evaluation of FasterCache.  Understanding CogVideoX is important for interpreting the results and evaluating the effectiveness of FasterCache in the context of a real-world text-to-video generation model.
